title: It took a while, but Mets are looking pretty legitimate these days
content: Turns out the Mets are who they were supposed to be after all. So don’t make those alternative October plans just yet. David Stearns’ blueprint for the 2024 season was a fairly simple one for his rookie season as the team's president of baseball operations: Evaluate the in-house talent, don’t go crazy with the owner’s checkbook and conservatively build a competitive roster that has a legit shot at a wild-card berth. Stearns had checked the first two boxes, but the third was looking a bit iffy...
